question: What degrees does IESE Business School offer?
answer: At IESE Business School, we offer many degree and non-degree programs. Our degree programs are: the Master in Management (MiM), MBA, Executive MBA (EMBA) and Global Executive MBA (GEMBA), plus the Master in Research in Management (MRM) and PhD in Management. In addition, we have a wide offering of Executive Education programs that range from short programs focused on a specific skill or industry, to longer-format programs with a general management approach.

question: Does IESE offer undergraduate degrees?
answer: No, IESE does not offer undergraduate degrees at this time, but the University of Navarra, the university to which we belong, offers nearly 50 undergraduate degrees in a wide range of subjects.

question: Can I apply to business school before completing my undergraduate degree?
answer: Yes, IESE's Master in Management (MiM) program is specifically designed for students who are completing, or have just completed, their undergraduate degree. A small number of our MBA students also apply during their last year of undergraduate studies for deferred admissions to the MBA program through the Young Talent Path which also allows undergraduates (and recent graduates) to experience the MBA.

question: Do I need work experience to attend IESE?
answer: Most of IESE's students and participants have prior work experience or are currently employed. For our Master in Management (MiM), however, no work experience is required.

question: What is IESE's positioning in recent rankings?
answer: IESE is regularly ranked among the best business schools in the world. Our Executive Education programs were ranked number three in the world in 2023 by the Financial Times. Our MBA program has been ranked among the best in Europe by The Economist, Bloomberg Businessweek and the Financial Times, among others.

question: How international is the learning environment?
answer: The learning environment at IESE is global in every way. We have campuses in five cities around the world and programs and modules in dozens of others, our study body is highly international and our professors and staff come from more than 50 different countries. In our MBA alone, there are approximately 55 nationalities.

question: What teaching methodologies are used in class?
answer: From the beginning, IESE has used the case method, which looks at real-life business examples, as the cornerstone of our teaching methodologies. But we are constantly innovating, introducing other active learning methodologies such as simulations, coaching and mentoring. We also are incorporating more digital elements into all our teaching.

question: What is the case method?
answer: The case method is an approach to teaching that has been at the center of the IESE experience since its founding. It involves presenting real-life business situations to students, who read and discuss the particular challenge, and also become decision-makers in how to resolve it.

question: Do I need a visa to study at IESE?
answer: Visa requirements vary depending on the country where the program is located, and on the nationality of each student.

question: Can I publish articles on your blogs?
answer: Most of IESE's blog posts are written by our professors or by school staff with particular expertise in the area. We currently do not accept contributions from outside of the school.

question: Where is the school based?
answer: IESE has five campuses in some of the world's most interesting, vibrant cities. IESE's main campus is in Barcelona, Spain, and we also have campuses in Madrid, Munich, New York and Sao Paulo.

question: Can I visit the campus?
answer: Many of IESE's programs hold Open Days to allow you to visit our campuses and experience IESE firsthand. Open Days are listed on the individual program's website, and you can also contact the program for further information.

question: What does IESE Business School stand for?
answer: IESE is, and always has been, driven by the desire to develop leaders who strive to have a deep, positive and lasting impact on people, companies and society through professional excellence, integrity and spirit of service.

question: What is the mission of IESE Business School?
answer: IESE's mission is to develop leaders who strive to have a deep, positive and lasting impact on people, companies and society through professional excellence, integrity and spirit of service.

question: Do I need to be Catholic to study at IESE?
answer: No, you do not need to be Catholic to study at IESE. IESE's values are based on the values of Christian humanism, but we welcome people of all religions and cultures who share our philosophy of respect for the individual and our dedication to society.

question: What is the relationship between Opus Dei and IESE Business School?
answer: IESE is the business school of the University of Navarra, and the university is an initiative of Opus Dei, a personal prelature of the Catholic Church. Personal prelatures are organizations within the Church that complement the work of local dioceses.

question: Where can I find more information about Opus Dei?
answer: You can find more information about Opus Dei at the official web page of the prelature.

question: What kinds of degrees does IESE offer?
answer: At IESE Business School, we offer many degree and non-degree programs. Our degree programs are: the Master in Management (MiM), MBA, Executive MBA (EMBA) and Global Executive MBA (GEMBA), plus the Master in Research in Management (MRM) and PhD in Management.

question: What is the difference between the MBA and Master in Management degrees?
answer: IESE's Master in Management (MiM) is designed for students who have just completed, or are about to complete, an undergraduate degree, and are looking to launch their business careers. The typical MBA candidate will have five to six years of work experience.

question: What are the admissions requirements for the IESE Master in Management program?
answer: Applicants must hold an undergraduate degree. Non-native English speakers must pass an English language test, as the program is taught in English. GMAT or GRE results are important, but not the determining factor in admission. An applicant's personality, motivation, goals, leadership abilities and communication skills will also be taken into account.

question: What are the admission requirements for your MBAs?
answer:
To apply to IESE's MBA program, applicants have completed a bachelor's degree or equivalent, submit all application requirements detailed on our website: application form, Kira video essays, application fee, university transcripts copy, GMAT*/GRE, English Test (if applicable), passport copy and one recommendation letter. Due to the nature of the case study method, three to ten years' work experience is recommended so that students have professional experience to share in class. Each case is different, and we take into account an applicant's personality, motivation, goals, leadership abilities and communication skills in the admissions process.
At IESE Business School, we take a holistic, personalized approach to admissions. Our GMAT exam (10th edition) acceptance range is 580-750, or 545-715 under the Focus edition, the average age of our recent MBA students is 29 and most have 5-6 years of work experience, they reflect diverse nationalities and while English is the language they have in common, many students are multilingual.
*We accept valid GMAT scores achieved through either the classic or new Focus edition equally.

question: What are the language requirements for a IESE MBA?
answer: English is the language of instruction of IESE's MBA. There is no test requirement for candidates whose first language is English, who have completed their university degree in English or who have lived at least two consecutive years in an English-speaking country. For all other candidates, IESE accepts recommended score of TOEFL 105, PTE Academic 68 (C1), IELTS 7.5 and Cambridge Certificate of Proficiency in English minimum level B. To send in your score to IESE, our TOEFL code is 7237 and IELTS code is CL035.

question: Do I need to speak Spanish to apply to the IESE MBA program?
answer: Spanish is not a requirement for admission. The official language at the IESE MBA Program is English. However, all students who are non-native Spanish speakers will have the option to enroll in the Business Spanish Program. The Business Spanish Program has different levels (1-10), from beginners to an advanced business Spanish level. Any knowledge of Spanish prior to the start of the Program will be in your advantage in obtaining a real level of fluency by the end of the MBA. If you complete the Business Spanish Program, you can request that your MBA diploma comes out as a Bilingual Diploma.

question: What is the deadline for applying to the MBA program?
answer:
The admission process begins in August. The earlier you apply to the MBA the better. IESE has four rounds of deadlines, with Round 4 being a rolling admission round. Further information regarding specific deadlines can be found here.
We recommend that all non-EU citizens apply before Round 3 in order to assure time for visa procedure. It is important to note that scholarships are more likely to be awarded in the first three rounds of the admissions process, with 70 percent of them being awarded in the first two rounds. Applications received after the deadline will be processed in the next application round.

question: How can I send my GMAT or GRE scores?
answer:
The GMAT or GRE is mandatory for all MBA candidates. IESE does not accept test scores that are more than five years old or photocopies of score reports, notarized or not.
For GMAT, you can refer to the instructions below on mba.com You can search by institution name, school name or location, for example: “IESE Business School” and select “MBA, Full Time”.

How Do I Send My Free Score Report(s) to Schools/Programs?
How Do I Send My Additional Score Reports to Schools/Programs?

For GRE, you can refer to the instructions below on ets.org. Our GRE code is 6951.

Sending Your GRE General Test Scores

question: What GMAT or GRE score do I need to be accepted into the MBA program?
answer:
IESE does not have a minimum required GMAT or GRE score*. Please keep in mind that the GMAT or GRE is just one of the criteria for admission. A high score does not guarantee admission, while a below average score does not eliminate a candidate. IESE's MBA GMAT exam (10th edition) acceptance range is 580-750, or 545-715 under the Focus edition. IESE recommends a score at or above 50th percentile under each format. GRE acceptance range is Verbal Range: 143-170, Quantitative Range: 143-170, Verbal Median: 156 and Quantitative Median: 161.
*We accept valid GMAT scores achieved through either the classic or new Focus edition equally. Scores will be assessed using the percentile tables published by GMAC. The comparisons between the original GRE test and the shorter version can be found here.

question: What are the admissions requirements for the Executive MBA?
answer: IESE's Executive MBA (EMBA) is a degree designed for executives with around 10 years of experience and who want to combine full-time work with their studies. To apply to the Executive MBA (EMBA), candidates must take the GMAT or Executive Assessment (EA), or IESE's admissions test, which assesses basic math skills, verbal reasoning and analytical writing; for non-native English speakers, a certificate verifying English-language proficiency; a letter of support from current employer; two letters of recommendation; university transcripts; and an application form. You will also have a personal interview with a IESE official.

question: Where do you offer the Executive MBA?
answer: IESE offers the Executive MBA on its Barcelona, Madrid, Munich and São Paulo campuses.

question: What language is used in the Executive MBA?
answer: English is an essential part of all of IESE's Executive MBA programs. In some of the Barcelona and Madrid programs, Spanish is also used and the programs are bi-lingual.

question: What are the admissions requirements for the Global Executive MBA?
answer: IESE's Global Executive MBA (GEMBA) is designed for international executives, normally with more than 15 years of experience, who wish to combine full-time work with their studies. The application process is highly personalized, but all candidates must submit two letters of reference, university transcripts and a letter of company support. The GMAT or Executive Assessment is required but may be waived in some cases; non-native English speakers must demonstrate English-language proficiency.

question: Where does the Global Executive MBA take place?
answer: IESE's Global Executive MBA (GEMBA) takes place in four business hubs: Barcelona, New York, Shanghai and Silicon Valley.

question: What are the benefits of attending an Executive Education program?
answer: IESE's Executive Education programs are transformational experiences that offer an integrative understanding of business, a global mindset and a values-based vision of the company. In addition to our general management courses, we also have shorter format, more specialized courses known as Focused Programs that deliver a particular skill. Graduates of our Executive Education programs enjoy the extensive benefits of IESE's international alumni network.

question: What is an open-enrollment program?
answer: IESE's open-enrollment programs are available to any individual who meets the admissions requirements. We also have custom programs, which are open only to people who work for a particular company or organization. These programs span a wide variety of industry sectors and participants hold an array of professional titles.

question: Are distance-learning opportunities available for executives?
answer: IESE uses a variety of formats, and many of our courses combine residential learning and online study. We also have a number of 100% online courses, listed in our portfolio of Focused Programs, and a handful of our courses are also available on the online platform Coursera.

question: What is the IESE Executive Education Certificate?
answer: To earn IESE's Executive Education Certificate, you must complete at least four focused programs, chosen with the support of an academic advisor. The certificate also makes you eligible to join IESE's Alumni Association.

question: Do I have to attend every session?
answer: Attendance and interaction with peers is an integral part of the IESE experience. However, we realize that emergencies do arise, and participants can make individual arrangements with professors and staff in the case of absences.

question: What is the typical day in an Executive Education program? How much free time will I have?
answer: A typical day in a full-time Executive Education program begins at 9am and ends at 7pm and consists of 5-6 classes, with breaks throughout the day. Part-time students typically have a daily schedule beginning at noon and ending at 7pm.

question: Where will I be staying?
answer: IESE does not offer on-campus housing, but we do assist participants who require accommodations by facilitating conveniently located hotels and other options.

question: How do I apply to a program?
answer: Each program has its own application process. Check the website of the individual program for details.

question: What are your admissions requirements?
answer: Each program has its own admissions requirements. Check the website of the individual program for details.

question: When is payment due?
answer: Many of IESE's Executive Education programs require payment of 10% of tuition within two weeks of acceptance in order to reserve your place. Full payment is due no later than 30 days before the start of the program.

question: What is your cancellation policy?
answer: For many Executive Education programs, cancellations must be made at least one month in advance of the start of the program in order to receive a refund. Cancellations made closer to the start of the program will be subject to a 25% cancellation fee.

question: Can you design a program for my organization?
answer: Yes, IESE's Custom Programs, which are consistently ranked best in the world by the Financial Times, are tailor-made to each company and organization. IESE's faculty works closely with you to design a powerful and transformative learning journey that aligns perfectly to your current reality and your future expectations.

question: Do you have a PhD program?
answer: Yes, IESE offers a PhD in Management.

question: Is there funding available for the PhD program?
answer: IESE's PhD candidates are fully funded, meaning that they receive a fee waiver and a stipend, so that they can concentrate fully on their studies.

question: How long does it take to complete the PhD program?
answer: IESE's PhD program normally takes four to five years to complete.

question: Are PhD candidates at IESE required to provide teaching assistance and/or research assistance?
answer: PhD candidates provide 10 hours per week of research assistance to professors. They are not required to work as teaching assistants during the program.

question: Is there any funding available to cover tuition fees at IESE Business School?
answer: Yes, there is a range of scholarships and loans available to IESE students, based on merit as well as financial need.

question: What scholarships does IESE offer?
answer: IESE offers a number of scholarships to students, including scholarships earmarked for MBA candidates who are women, come from developing countries, show outstanding merit, and others. IESE's financial aid website contains information on financing options, and our Financial Aid Office can offer further assistance.

question: What is the average employability of your MBA?
answer: IESE MBAs are highly sought after in the job market. According to our latest Employment Report, 94% of our students had at least one job offer within three months of graduation.

question: Can I search both student and alumni CVs?
answer: IESE's Career Development Center works with students, alumni, companies and organizations to match people searching for jobs with the organizations that need them.

question: How do I post a job online?
answer: On IESE's Career Development Center page, you will find links to register online and post jobs. You will also find contact information for our team for any questions you may have.
